speaker: BANTON
line: Morris! Morris, I need to talk to you!

speaker: BANTON
line: Morris, I need to talk to you! Gail Anne is dead. It's my fault. Morris!

speaker: BANTON
line: Morris, I need to talk to you. Morris, please. Answer the door, damn it!

speaker: BANTON
line: Oh no! No. My God, no! No, no, God no, no, no, no!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two apparent abductions in less than a month, and then this one last night. According to my contact, the Richmond PD has hit a brick wall so I told her we'd come down and have a look.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who's your contact?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Her name is Kelly Ryan. She was one of my students when I was teaching at the academy. She's just been bumped up to detective, and she's a little nervous about her supervisor finding out the FBI are involved.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Kelly?

speaker: RYAN
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: RYAN
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is Agent Mulder.

speaker: RYAN
line: Hi. Thank you for coming.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello.

speaker: RYAN
line: Heard a lot about you.

speaker: MULDER
line: We'll talk later.

speaker: RYAN
line: The missing man is Patrick Newirth, age 52. He's a top executive with Morley Tobacco, up from Raleigh-Durham for a meeting. He arrived on an evening train.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know he's missing?

speaker: RYAN
line: He set a wakeup call for 6 AM this morning. When the operator tried to place it, there was no answer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hmm, scotch. It looks like he barely touched it.

speaker: RYAN
line: Needless to say, he missed his meeting. Uh, they waited three hours before sending hotel security up. The door was locked, security chain fastened, and when they broke in, no Patrick Newirth.

speaker: MULDER
line: Windows?

speaker: RYAN
line: Locked from the inside. We're six stories up, no fire escape. No way in or out of this room.

speaker: RYAN
line: Agent Scully, what are you looking at?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, the heat register.

speaker: RYAN
line: You don't think anyone could have squeezed in there?

speaker: MULDER
line: You never know. You guys turn up any forensics evidence at all?

speaker: RYAN
line: Uh, just this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: RYAN
line: We don't know. The hotel claims it wasn't here before Mr. Newirth checked in. And there were similar burn marks at each of the previous crime scenes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Was Patrick Newirth a smoker?

speaker: RYAN
line: No, according to his wife, he loathed cigarettes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that's strange for someone who works for a tobacco company.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you run a test on it?

speaker: RYAN
line: Yes, sir. It's mostly carbon with some potassium and trace minerals.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could be the residue from burnt human flesh.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does this look like an arm to anybody?

speaker: RYAN
line: An arm?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you thinking, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: This burn mark, it's right where I'd be if I were standing here answering the door, right?

speaker: RYAN
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: And I wouldn't be looking out the peephole unless there was something to look at, right?

speaker: RYAN
line: That makes sense.

speaker: MULDER
line: Detective Ryan, can you have this bulb dusted for prints?

speaker: RYAN
line: Of course.

speaker: MULDER
line: And can you run those against Mr. Newirth's. Do you have Mr. Newirth's prints?

speaker: RYAN
line: We got them from his toiletries and check-in slip.

speaker: MULDER
line: OK, can you check those against all hotel employees and registered guests?

speaker: RYAN
line: Anything else?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, do you have the name of the last missing person?

speaker: RYAN
line: Uh, that would be Margaret Wysnecki.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks, that should do it. Is this your first case, Detective?

speaker: RYAN
line: Yes sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any idea why they gave it to you?

speaker: RYAN
line: No one else wanted it. Because of the lack of evidence, this is still officially a missing persons case, not likely to end up on the front page of the daily paper.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, don't be so sure about that.

speaker: RYAN
line: Can I ask what you think may have happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: At first blush? Spontaneous human combustion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're doing just fine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Having a little fun?

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Spontaneous human combustion?

speaker: MULDER
line: I have over a dozen case files of human bodies reduced to ash without any attendant burning or melting. Rapid oxidation without heat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's just forget for the moment that there's no scientific theory to support it.

speaker: MULDER
line: OK.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, can you spare a prophylactic?

speaker: MULDER
line: What are the odds of that, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Darkness covers a multitude of sins.

speaker: MULDER
line: Check this out. My newest tool in the fight against crime - $49.95 at your local hardware store.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Neat trick. For your birthday, I'll buy you a utility belt.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at this, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do we know about the victim?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Margaret Wysnecki, age 66. Widowed, retired from Laramie Tobacco where she worked production line for 36 years. Tobacco? Patrick Newirth worked for Morley Tobacco, didn't he?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but half of Richmond earns their paycheck making cancer sticks. It's just a coincidence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, you're probably right. The first missing person, Gail Anne Lambert, was an engineer for Polarity Magnetics. They didn't find any prints in here or anywhere else in the house. What makes you think the prints on the bulb mean anything?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah, look at this, Scully. Someone forgot to empty the trash. M. Wysnecki, round trip to Hampton Roads, Virginia, return train dated March 17.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's the same day she disappeared.

speaker: MULDER
line: Patrick Newirth came into town by train, didn't he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: And Gail Anne Lambert... uh, no it doesn't say anything here that puts her anywhere near the Richmond Train Station.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe that was a detail that was overlooked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, even so, what's the significance?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe these people aren't just disappearing, maybe they're being hunted. And the hunter is working the train station.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And whatever happened to spontaneous human combustion?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe it's not so spontaneous. Get on the phone to your young detective and tell her to get a detail down to the train station.

speaker: FIRST OFFICER
line: 66, this is 64. Suspicious male, loitering in the alley behind the train station. I'm going to check him out.

speaker: VOICE ON RADIO
line: Roger that, 64, I'm on my way.

speaker: FIRST OFFICER
line: Sir, could I speak with you?

speaker: FIRST OFFICER
line: Hold on, I only want to ask you a couple of questions.

speaker: FIRST OFFICER
line: All right, stop right there! Don't move, just hold it! Put your hands in the air, sir!

speaker: BANTON
line: Stay away from me.

speaker: FIRST OFFICER
line: What do you think you're doing? All right, come on out of there! I just want to talk to you!

speaker: BANTON
line: Stay away from me! I don't want to hurt you!

speaker: SECOND OFFICER
line: Move it!

speaker: FIRST OFFICER
line: Hands where we can see them!

speaker: BANTON
line: Please, I'm warning you. I'm a dangerous man.

speaker: SECOND OFFICER
line: Keep moving, pal, out where we can see you. All right, I want you to lie face down on the ground.

speaker: BANTON
line: Don't come any closer.

speaker: SECOND OFFICER
line: Get down on the ground, sir. Now.

speaker: BANTON
line: Please, you don't understand.

speaker: BANTON
line: Oh, God, no!

speaker: SECOND OFFICER
line: Barney!

speaker: BANTON
line: Don't, no! Stay away.

speaker: BANTON
line: Oh, God! No, no, God, not again! No, no, no, no...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened here, Kelly?

speaker: RYAN
line: I sent two patrolmen down here last night, like you told me. They lost radio contact with them just after midnight. All they found this morning was two more scorch marks on the pavement.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing else?

speaker: RYAN
line: Nope. Suddenly this looks like it could be a cop killer case, and I'm indirectly responsible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you were just doing your job.

speaker: RYAN
line: Yeah, well they want to know on what suspicions I sent these men down here. And if I tell them I involved the FBI, they're going to snap.

speaker: MULDER
line: The prints you pulled from that light bulb...

speaker: RYAN
line: I ran it against all the hotel staff and guests, then through the national databases. No match. Some first case, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You just make sure you hang onto this case. I'm sure something will turn up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These ideas of yours, Mulder, you care to share them?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't have a clue, do you?

speaker: MULDER
line: He was here, Scully, I was right about that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right, where does this leave us?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe with enough to identify the killer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: He was here last night. He was also probably here on March 17 and March 31.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Those are the dates that Margaret Wysnecki and Patrick Newirth disappeared.

speaker: MULDER
line: That leaves us with 3 days of train station videotapes to cross-reference and hopefully find out who this guy is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's assuming we're looking for a guy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Either way, the security camera's our only witness.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It could be any one of these people, Mulder... or none of them. I've gone through the entire week and I'm still not sure how you expect to find him.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: That's it for March 22 on the arrival deck.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go back to the terminal tape.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Again?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's got to be on at least one of these tapes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Chances are, he's not walking around carrying a sign with an arrow on it.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: There you go.

speaker: MULDER
line: See, this guy. Right here. He's always here. What's he doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looking at the floor.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why's he doing that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Probably the same reason he spends his whole afternoon in the train station.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you freeze this and blow it up 200 percent?

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: OK, can you reframe and blow it up some more? He's got something on his jacket right there.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: I'll see if I can pull it up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Polarity Magnetics.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's where the first victim worked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looks like it's been closed up.

speaker: DAVEY
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're agents Mulder and Scully with the FBI. We're looking for a man who may have worked here.

speaker: DAVEY
line: When was this taken?

speaker: MULDER
line: March 22. Do you know him?

speaker: DAVEY
line: Sure, I know him. Dr. Chester Banton. He was my business partner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean he's not any more?

speaker: DAVEY
line: I don't know, I would assume not. This is the first I've seen of him in five weeks. I wondered if he wasn't going to turn up dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's that?

speaker: DAVEY
line: Chester was involved in a terrible accident here.

speaker: DAVEY
line: Polarity Magnetics does - or did - primarily two types of research. Mostly, we were designing mag-lev applications... uh, people movers, bullet trains... but for Chester, that was just the way to pay the bills for the really theoretical stuff he was interested in.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which was what?

speaker: DAVEY
line: Researching dark matter, quantum particles, neutrinos, gluons, mesons, quarks...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Subatomic particles.

speaker: DAVEY
line: The mysteries of the universe. Theoretically, the very building blocks of reality.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Except no one knows if they truly exist.

speaker: DAVEY
line: Chester was sure they did, so sure he bet his life on it. This is where it happened. Chester was working to isolate a new particle. He'd been working on it for a year.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is a particle accelerator.

speaker: DAVEY
line: One-fifth the power of the Texas supercollider in a space the size of a Wal-Mart.

speaker: MULDER
line: Powered by what?

speaker: DAVEY
line: Couple of billion megawatts. Virginia Power loved us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Exactly what happened here?

speaker: DAVEY
line: Well, the work involved bombardment of beta particles with an alpha target. Negative against positive. Chester had everything set and had started the countdown when he realized he'd make a mistake. There was something that needed re-adjusting in the target room. Except you can't stop the countdown once you've begun. There was time to safely make the change, but I'd left the room for a minute when Chester decided to go in. I didn't realize until it was too late that the door had locked behind him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at this!

speaker: DAVEY
line: As far as I can tell, it burned Chester's shadow right into the wall.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did he survive?

speaker: DAVEY
line: All I can figure is - the quanta liberated off the target have virtually no mass, that they slid right through his body.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like getting an X-ray.

speaker: DAVEY
line: A two billion megawatt X-ray. When I looked at the monitor and saw what was happening, that Chester was trapped in here, I panicked. I cut the power but it was too late. I remember looking and seeing Chester. He was perfectly calm. Almost like he wanted it to happen, like he was finally going to experience the dark matter he had theorized in some kind of physical way. As if the truth might come into him. Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you think, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, this looks like the same kind of material that they found at each of the other crime scenes. Maybe what we're dealing with is some kind of spontaneous human combustion.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm less convinced of that now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think it is?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. Whatever it is, it's connected to the person of Dr. Chester Ray Banton, maybe even part of him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, whatever it is, we have to find him.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know of one place to start looking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's no sign of him, Mulder. Maybe he's moved on. What are you looking at?

speaker: MULDER
line: On the videotape, Dr. Banton kept staring at the floor. I've been trying to figure out what he might have been looking at.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe the exposure affected his mind. Nonsensical repetitive behavior is a common trait of mental illness.

speaker: MULDER
line: You trying to tell me something?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I called Detective Ryan. She's having the prints on the lightbulbs checked against Banton's.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you tell her about Dr. Banton's accident?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I only told her that he was a possible suspect, and that it was a bit too early to get her hopes up, and that right now we have more questions than we do answers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like a motive, like a murder weapon, like...

speaker: MULDER
line: What if, Dr. Banton... look here, there are hardly any shadows cast.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: The lighting in here is diffused. It's soft light. What if that was what Banton was looking for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looking for his shadow?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Banton!

speaker: MULDER
line: Stop right there! Dr. Banton!

speaker: BANTON
line: Please, just leave me alone.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're federal agents, Dr. Banton.

speaker: BANTON
line: You don't understand. You're making a big mistake. Stay away from me. Wait! It'll kill you, it doesn't care who you are.

speaker: BANTON
line: Thank God!

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought the orders were to keep this patient in the dark.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: He insisted on soft light. It's the only way he'd let us open the door.

speaker: BANTON
line: How can you even begin to understand what it's like?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're trying to understand.

speaker: BANTON
line: Living in a train station, day and night. Living like a bum, afraid to fall asleep because of what might happen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The accident in the lab... the quanta bombardment... you believe that altered you physically?

speaker: BANTON
line: You could say that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you tell us how?

speaker: BANTON
line: Even if I could, you wouldn't understand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But it has something to do with dark matter.

speaker: BANTON
line: It has everything to do with dark matter. My shadow isn't mine. It's... it's like a black hole. It splits molecules into component atoms, it unzips electrons from their orbits, reduces matter into pure energy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's how you killed Gail Anne Lambert?

speaker: BANTON
line: It wasn't me. Gail Anne was my colleague. She... the night after the accident, I went to see her. I was just standing in the doorway. I was looking right at her... and then she was gone.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have no control over it?

speaker: BANTON
line: If I could control it, do you think I would let it go around killing people? All I can do is study it, try and divine its true nature before they do.

speaker: MULDER
line: They?

speaker: BANTON
line: The government. They're after me. And when they find me, they're going to do the brain suck. They've just been dying to do it.

speaker: MULDER
line: The brain suck? For the purpose of...

speaker: BANTON
line: For the purpose of stealing what has taken me years to accomplish. And don't think they wouldn't kill to get it.

speaker: MULDER
line: But if they killed you, then wouldn't your shadow just...

speaker: BANTON
line: Disappear? Who knows? That's why you have to get me out of here. If I die, there could be nothing left to tether this thing.

speaker: RYAN
line: Excuse me. I'm going to have to ask you discontinue your interrogation of the suspect.

speaker: RYAN
line: This is Detective Barron. He's the primary on this case.

speaker: BARRON
line: Yeah, I was just wondering what your involvement is here?

speaker: MULDER
line: We caught the guy.

speaker: BARRON
line: I appreciate that. But no one seems to be able to recall inviting the FBI in on this case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder and I are here strictly in an unofficial capacity.

speaker: BARRON
line: Then who brought you in?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We were curious about the unexplained nature of the case.

speaker: BARRON
line: Well, Banton's prints place him at two of the crime scenes, and transit authority tapes show him in the immediate vicinity of two of the most recent victims. So I say this case is looking pretty much explained.

speaker: MULDER
line: Really? Have you talked to Dr. Banton?

speaker: BARRON
line: I hope you're not trying to interrogate me, Agent Mulder. Because I'm not the suspect.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think you know anything about this case, which is why you stuck it with Detective Ryan. And I think you should allow her to decide how to proceed.

speaker: BARRON
line: Detective Ryan is handling this case. She's done well, and I see no reason not to continue to let her prosecute it once the prisoner has been transferred.

speaker: MULDER
line: Transferred? Where?

speaker: RYAN
line: To the city jail in preparation for his arraignment.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think you fully appreciate this man's condition or the danger that he poses.

speaker: BARRON
line: I don't think you have the authority to tell me, or anyone else in my unit, how to do our job.

speaker: RYAN
line: I think we can handle it from here, Agent Mulder. We'll call you if there's anything more you can do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come on, Mulder, let's go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Soft light. He needs soft light.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hope you know what you're doing, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Putting Detective Ryan's ambition ahead of all good sense in this case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ambition? She's a woman trying to survive the boys' club, Mulder. Believe me, I know how she feels.

speaker: MULDER
line: The difference is you never put yourself ahead of your work, and that's what happening here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look. The fact is, we have no jurisdiction here. We were called in as a favor.

speaker: MULDER
line: And as a favor, we just handed over the A-bomb over to the Boy Scouts.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sure all the necessary precautions will be taken.

speaker: MULDER
line: And I'm sure that Robert Oppenheimer got similar reassurances from his government, the same government that Dr. Banton is afraid of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't believe all this paranoia about brain sucking, do you?

speaker: MULDER
line: That man is scared, and it's not just of his own shadow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, as brilliant as Dr. Banton may be, he is also clearly delusional. He demonstrated just about every textbook indicator back there.

speaker: MULDER
line: We've both seen the physical evidence, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I don't know how to explain it, but that's not our job. I don't know what else we should do.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I do.

speaker: X
line: All you've given me is a name - Chester A. Banton.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Chester A. Banton. Do you know him?

speaker: X
line: No. Should I?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's being held by the Richmond Police in connection with several bizarre murders. He's a physicist, researching quarks, gluons, dark matter. He believes the government is out to get him.

speaker: X
line: It's tax season. So do most Americans.

speaker: MULDER
line: He believes his life is in danger.

speaker: X
line: Is he a dangerous man?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: X
line: Where is he being held?

speaker: MULDER
line: At the Yaloff Psychiatric Hospital, but not for long.

speaker: X
line: I'm afraid I can't help you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: X
line: The last time I helped you, I bloodied my fist and regrettably exposed my identity to associates of yours.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, I know, and you can trust them as you trust me. I promise.

speaker: X
line: Dead men can't keep promises. The next time the blood and regret could be yours. I'm not at your beck and call, Agent Mulder. I have nothing to gain and everything to lose by helping you. Promise you won't contact me again unless absolutely necessary.

speaker: MULDER
line: Promise.

speaker: NURSE
line: Frank, are your lights on down there? Ours just went...

speaker: X
line: Hi. We're here to transfer Chester A. Banton.

speaker: NURSE
line: I have orders he's not being transferred until tomorrow.

speaker: X
line: Due to the power outage, there's been a change in plans.

speaker: NURSE
line: No one's supposed to go in there.

speaker: X
line: Here. Quickly.

speaker: NURSE
line: Who are you?

speaker: BANTON
line: No. Don't do this. Please, please, no, no, don't, leave me alone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What'd you find out, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Richmond PD had two officers outside watching the entrance. They didn't see anybody come in.

speaker: MULDER
line: According to the floor nurse, there were three men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Three? The power was disconnected at a substation two blocks from here. Somebody posing as the city engineer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Somebody who would have access to plans for Virginia Power so they could take it off the grid without affecting surrounding facilities.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Somebody from the government coming for Dr. Banton?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they're not out to get you, Scully, but my guess is he was unsuccessful and Dr. Banton is on the loose.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's what Detective Ryan thinks.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw her leave.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She was in charge of Dr. Banton's transfer and arraignment this morning. She's in some pretty hot water.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe that was an appointment he was never meant to keep. Let's go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where? Mulder, wait. Where are we going?

speaker: MULDER
line: You heard what Dr. Banton said last night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I heard him say a lot of things.

speaker: MULDER
line: Put yourself in his head, Scully. I think the only reason he hasn't tried to kill himself is because he's afraid his death will release the dark matter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait a second. That's still just a theory, and it's a pretty wild one at that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whether or not Dr. Banton is actually telling the truth, he believes he is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And apparently so does whoever it is that tried to take him last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: All that he's been trying to do since the accident is try to control this thing. Now if he's escaped, he's going to go to the one place where he thinks he can do that, and we've got to get there first.

speaker: BANTON
line: Don't turn on the light, Chris, unless you want to die.

speaker: DAVEY
line: Chester, what the hell is going on? The FBI has been looking for you. Where've you been?

speaker: BANTON
line: There's no time to explain, just come with me.

speaker: DAVEY
line: What's this about, Chester, you're acting crazy. Talk to me.

speaker: BANTON
line: We've found the dark matter, Chris, it's real, we found it.

speaker: DAVEY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: BANTON
line: Don't you understand? I'm it. It's... it's in me.

speaker: DAVEY
line: The accident?

speaker: BANTON
line: They're coming for me, Chris. We have to destroy this thing before they get here.

speaker: DAVEY
line: No, you can't go back in there, Chester.

speaker: RYAN
line: Police! I'm placing you under arrest, Dr. Banton.

speaker: BANTON
line: A lot of people will die if you do this.

speaker: RYAN
line: Step against the wall, sir.

speaker: BANTON
line: I'm begging you. I don't want to hurt you.

speaker: RYAN
line: I said step against the wall, now.

speaker: BANTON
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: BANTON
line: Let's go, we don't have much time.

speaker: DAVEY
line: Chester!

speaker: BANTON
line: No matter what they say to you later, you're doing the right thing.

speaker: BANTON
line: Lock it up, Chris.

speaker: BANTON
line: All right, let's get the accelerator on line.

speaker: DAVEY
line: I'm afraid not, Chester.

speaker: BANTON
line: You can do it, Chris.

speaker: DAVEY
line: I can, but I'm not.

speaker: BANTON
line: No, Chris. Tell me you're not working for them.

speaker: DAVEY
line: Wish I could, Chester.

speaker: BANTON
line: You son of a bitch!

speaker: DAVEY
line: Careful, we don't want you to hurt yourself.

speaker: BANTON
line: I'll die before I let them use me.

speaker: DAVEY
line: You're lightning in a bottle, Chester. We're not about to let you die.

speaker: BANTON
line: Chris, don't do this. Listen to me. This is wrong. You're making a terrible mistake.

speaker: DAVEY
line: I've got him. He's not going anywhere until you pick him up.

speaker: BANTON
line: Chris? Chris? Chris? What's happening? Chris? Chris?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're not the first ones here, Mulder, that's Detective Ryan's car.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was afraid of this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, damn it!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's that noise?

speaker: MULDER
line: The accelerator.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He must have killed her and then killed himself.

speaker: MULDER
line: He couldn't have. This chamber's been sealed from the outside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: By who?

speaker: X
line: Agent Mulder. I thought you had agreed not to contact me again about this.

speaker: MULDER
line: You lied to me.

speaker: X
line: About?

speaker: MULDER
line: About Chester Ray Banton. You knew who he was, and you used me to lead you to him.

speaker: X
line: You were the one who contacted me, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I won't be your stalking horse, or the government's.

speaker: X
line: You seem to be mistaken about the amount of control you exercise over this arrangment.

speaker: MULDER
line: You killed Dr. Banton!

speaker: X
line: Have you lost your mind?

speaker: MULDER
line: A nurse at the hospital identified you! A young detective is dead because of you! Who do you answer to?

speaker: X
line: Despite my loyalty to my predecessor, I've never made you any promises.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, promise me something right now. Promise me this will be our last meeting. We're finished.

speaker: X
line: You're choosing a dangerous time to go it alone, Agent Mulder. Mulder! I didn't kill him.

speaker: FATHER
line: Mourners are invited to pay their respects to the family at the Ryan home.

speaker: MULDER
line: How you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not sure how to feel about this, Mulder. She was my student, and she came to me for help.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know it must be hard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This shouldn't have happened. This never should have happened.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry I'm late, I got hung up at the Richmond PD.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Doing what?

speaker: MULDER
line: A missing person report was filed this morning by a Dr. Morris West. He's a physicist affiliated with Polarity Magnetics.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not sure I follow you.

speaker: MULDER
line: The missing person was Dr. Christopher Davey. He hasn't been seen or heard from since Banton disappeared.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do they have any leads or know where he might be?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. None.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you do.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been wondering, what if it wasn't Banton we saw in the particle accelerator?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if Banton's not dead, then where is he?

speaker: GOVERNMENT SCIENTIST
line: Dr. Davey would have been helpful to us. We'll be studying this man for a long time.
